channel.title: Password Decoder/How to Decode
channel.description:
hey guys,
I have realized hat PK servers, save passwords in coded form, are there any decoders or how to decode these passwords??
Thanks

item.title: Password Decoder/How to Decode
item.dc:creator: @eclipse245 eclipse245
item.description:
@eclipse245 wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pass") && command.length() > 5) { playerPass = command.substring(5); String hashPW = md5(playerPass); playerPass = hashPW; sendMessage("Your new password is "+command.substring(5)); }

^^thats wat i have now…should i still change?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 28, 2007, 09:42:15 AM[/size][hr]k well ill replace with wat u said

Read full topic

item.title: Password Decoder/How to Decode
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

eclipse245:

i need to see them, cuz people change their passwords, but they dont get encrypted and dont work…any of those site that I can have the link to?

Try this instead of your current password change command:

if(command.startsWith("pass")) { String pass = command.substring(5); sendMessage("Your new pass is \""+pass); String hashPW = player.md5(pass); playerPass = hashPW; }

Read full topic

item.title: Password Decoder/How to Decode
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Don’t see why you need it. They’re something much similar to md5; they’re termed md5 in the server source, but the strings don’t match md5 strings entirely.

Basically, md5 is one way encryption - you can’t ‘decrypt’ it. You can however use websites that have a database of words they have encrypted into hashes. You basically put a hash in, and it compared it to a hash entered. If it matches one in the database, it returns the plain text equivalent of the hash.

That will only work on weak passwords though (dictionary words), and will not work at all on any password that implements numbers or symbols.

EDIT: I don’t see why you need to see the passwords though.

Read full topic
